text.title: U S TRADE OFFICIAL SAYS JAPAN ACTION FOOLISH
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank Reuters
text.body: A high level U S trade official be foolish Japan to strike back against United States sanctions on Japanese semiconductor electronics products Asked by reporters if Japan expected to retaliate against U S exports Deputy Under Secretary Commerce Bruce Smart replied That be height foolishness addition he doubted Japan could show enough progress meeting conditions agreement to avoid actual imposition dlrs tariffs on April Japan s billion dlr trade surplus United States year come under fire Congress concerned loss jobs to foreign competition record billion dlrs U S trade deficit President Reagan s sanctions decision won praise today two Democratic leaders Congress I think s time Senate Democratic Leader Robert Byrd West Virginia told reporters House Speaker Jim Wright Texas told reporters before opening House session It just shows we were right all along when we something needs doing Smart testified before Senate Labor Committee hearing Friday s U S trade action help U S negotiations on access to Japan U S auto parts Since August Smart been leading talks to open up Japan to purchases more U S made automotive parts year Japan racked up billion dlr trade surplus United States these products Both countries expect to conclude talks by August It s amazing to me Japanese were surprised I hope persuade them we re serious Smart White House trade sanctions United States tried to convince Japanese car companies quality American made parts to draw them away their traditional Japanese suppliers All we ask chance We job to do persuading them we can do better than our reputation seems to be he Measured per car each American made car contained dlrs Japanese auto parts while each Japanese made car contained dlrs U S auto parts Smart

text.title: FED S POLICY EASE MAY END WITH ND QTR RATE CUT
text.author: By Martin Cherrin Reuters
text.body: The Federal Reserve s move to easier monetary policy begun four quick half point discount rate cuts likely end final rate drop second quarter analysts poll economists shows most expect interest rates to edge lower Fed likely to drop basic lending rate pct late next quarter to help economy The Fed likely to ease policy much further without full blown recession Raymond Stone chief financial economist at Merrill Lynch Capital Markets Stone economic data available by late June may be just weak enough to prompt one more discount rate cut But he may only be quarter point drop instead usual half point to avoid hurting dollar further All economists agreed Federal Open Market Committee tomorrow leave Fed policy unchanged average forecast those surveyed projects roughly quarter point drops by end June both Treasury bond yield to pct Federal funds rate at banks lend to one another to pct Most expect prime lending rate at major banks to remain at pct Other broad predictions survey relating mainly to April June quarter follow dollar likely to decline five to pct further against other major currencies because large U S budget deficit wide but narrowing trade gap Contacted after dollar s steep drop two business days economists reaffirmed view but stressed risk dollar fall more rather than less than they expect Oil prices second quarter likely to continue trading roughly between dlrs barrel could well test lower end range Stocks continue to outperform bonds next quarter probably all Stocks should gain on strong foreign demand modest second half economic rise outlook bonds also less favorable later year since both inflation interest rates may be edging up Inflation as measured by GNP implicit price deflator rise to around pct year pct sharp fall dollar to date add to inflation as mild economic pickup second half year U S real gross national product grew at two pct annual rate second half should expand at respective rates pct pct first second halves First quarter growth put at pct annual rate slowing to pct next quarter Robert Brusca Nikko Securities Co International sees both strongest economy highest interest rates among those surveyed He expects real GNP grew at pct rate fourth quarter to expand at pct rate quarter pct next quarter The economy bounce back more strongly than many expect Brusca He involuntary buildup inventories largely autos add to first quarter economic growth consumer spending helping later We re running out special factors to keep economy afloat Philip Braverman Irving Securities Corp His interest rate economic forecasts were among lowest Braverman tax law changes inventory accumulation helped lift fourth first quarter GNP growth respectively He expects pct first quarter growth but second quarter growth could be zero or negative Braverman economic activity next quarter suffer paring inventories lower capital investment slow government spending less construction Only marginally narrower trade deficit add to growth He sees pct end of June yield on Treasury bonds Federal funds prime rates at seven pct respectively Nikko s Brusca projects rates pct bonds pct funds pct prime rate Two economists revised rate forecasts up mildly after dollar s fall to year lows versus yen past days news pending U S trade sanctions against Japan David Resler Nomura Securities Co International Inc raised his end June bond yield forecast to pct pct Fed funds rate estimate to six pct pct Raul Nicho president Money Market Services Inc lifted his forecast bond Fed funds rates eighth point to eight pct bonds pct funds Both Nicho Resler left their end June prime rate forecast at pct higher rate forecasts reflected belief Japanese investors be less eager to buy U S bonds because fear further dollar erosion perhaps response to U S trade sanctions Yields may to rise to lure other buyers END JUNE U S INTEREST RATE FORECASTS T bonds Fed funds Prime Nikko Securities Money Mkt Services Discount Corp Merrill Lynch Bankers Trust Wells Fargo Bank Irving Securities Dean Witter FORECAST AVERAGE CURRENT LEVELS

reuters.unknown: C G T f reute r f PM COMMUNITY FARM

text.title: EC MINISTERS DIFFER WIDELY ON FARM PRICE PLAN
text.author: By Gerrard Raven Reuters
text.body: European Community EC agriculture ministers gave widely diverging reactions to EC executive Commission proposals radical reduction guaranteed prices EC s farmers plans could cut price received by farmers by over pct many cases were dismissed by West German minister Ignaz Kiechle as part unacceptable part even basis negotiation diplomatic sources At other end scale Britain s Michael Jopling some products they did go far enough to reduce massive spending on EC s farm policy major factor brought Community close to budget crisis Ministers discussed Commission s farm price proposals first time sources negotiations could several months yet Belgian minister Paul de Keersmaeker who chairing meeting told his colleagues he even attempt to reach agreement at current meeting due to end Tuesday although prices supposed to be agreed by April disagreement among ministers reflects deep divisions among member states future EC s farm policy swallows two thirds annual billion European Currency Unit billion dollar budget Kiechle backed generally by his French Italian several other colleagues believes sacrifices by traditional family farmers must be kept to minimum order to maintain viable rural communities Europe Jopling some support Netherlands Denmark on whole backs proposals by EC farm commissioner Frans Andriessen to cut guaranteed prices reduce opportunities sales surplus products into EC stores He believes system allows such sales nominally as resort become abused resulting huge stocks damaging trade tensions other major world food exporters Jopling told journalists now costing EC Ecus hectare dlrs acre to subsidise cotton production double figure growing certain types tobacco Opening yesterday s debate Andriessen accused officials some EC states ignoring realities They give impression living on another planet where there no surpluses no budgetary deficits no budgetary discipline farm spending he One Andriessen scheme closing budget gap could already be doomed diplomats He wants to raise two billion Ecus billion dlrs through tax on EC produced imported oilseeds already raised hackles Washington because fears impact on U S soybean exports Jopling earlier enough EC states appear opposed to scheme to block adoption provided they all stand firm lengthy negotiations ahead on Commission proposals

text.title: CANADA BANKS COULD SEE PRESSURE ON BRAZIL LOANS
text.author: By Peter Cooney Reuters
text.body: Canada s major banks likely face stiff pressure to declare their Brazilian loans non performing if as expected major U S banks take similar action after end their first quarter tomorrow analysts American bankers week slow progress debt talks Brazil increased likelihood U S banks soon declare their Brazilian loans non performing Such action would put lot pressure on Canadian banks to do same Levesque Beaubien Inc Toronto based bank analyst Donna Pulcine told Reuters They banks like to appear to be conservative Pulcine and if major bank puts loans on non performing basis Canadian banks don t there going to be lot pressure shareholders as to why one bank considering loans non performing another bank Wood Gundy Inc bank analyst Patricia Meredith any willingness by major Brazilian bank creditor such as Citicorp CCI to declare Brazilian loans non performing rather than let Brazil dictate settlement terms provide compelling example other creditor banks In order to make strategy work they Citicorp to support other banks Meredith Bank analyst Michael Walsh at First Marathon Securities Ltd at least one Canadian bank he declined to identify wants to put the Brazilian loans on non performing basis trying to encourage others to take position Canadian banks owed seven billion Canadian dlrs by Brazil late month suspended interest payments on billion U S dlr foreign bank debt Banks Canada although allowed to wait up to days before declaring loans on they receiving no interest as non performing usually move on such loans within days They could therefore delay action on Brazilian loans until late May falls Canadian banks third quarter ending July Bank Montreal Brazil s largest Canadian bank creditor week currently considering declaring billion dlrs Brazilian loans as non performing I think just benefit public Walsh Bank Montreal s statement Some analysts predicted minimal earnings impact on Canadian banks move to declare Brazilian loans non performing They Brazil likely resume interest payments by banks fiscal year end on October thus allowing banks to recoup their lost interest income From what Brazil quite likely banks get money Meredith My outlook at point optimistic there be no adjustment full year s earnings Meredith forecast fully diluted per share earnings dlrs Royal Bank Canada compared dlrs Bank Montreal compared dlrs Canadian Imperial Bank Commerce compared dlrs Bank Nova Scotia compared dlrs Toronto Dominion Bank against She forecast dlrs National Bank Canada against dlrs before two one stock split Analyst Pulcine she might lower full year earnings estimates banks by between two cts cts share assuming possible settlement reduced Brazil s interest costs If banks didn t receive anything rest fiscal year impact could range cts to cts share But I don t see as likely scenario Pulcine Walsh at First Marathon suggested however Brazilian debt situation so complex it could drag on beyond one full fiscal year He he foresaw having to lower his fiscal earnings forecasts banks He estimated Brazil s yearly interest payments to Canadian banks totaled dlrs or pct their total pre tax earnings

text.title: PHILIPPINES TO REPAY SOME PRINCIPAL IN
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: The Philippine government quietly agreed to make token payments principal each next three years as part billion dlr commercial bank debt rescheduling package finalized Friday bankers Manila pay foreign banks dlrs year representing four pct dlr loan signed Amortizations on loan were due to begin until but Philippines agreed to make extra dlr prepayment order to win relatively low interest margin pct over Eurodollar rates bankers Bankers they insisted on principal repayments so they could justify margin pct by drawing direct parallel between Philippines Venezuela won pct spread on billion dlr debt rescheduling package month After Venezuelan deal clinched leading New York bankers hurried to argue pct new benchmark spread debtor nation current on interest seeking new money amortizing loan principal Previously pct margin granted to Mexico seen by debtors as margin to strive Philippines met first two Venezuelan criteria but third adamant could accept spread higher than pct Bankers could back down either because they to sacrifice millions dollars profits may thrown door open to other debtors notably Argentina Brazil to claim even finer spreads than Mexico s end compromise saved face banks The banks were agonizing how to reconcile package Venezuela s allowed them to walk out say We ve kept faith Venezuelan precedent one source prepayments although modest were apparently something Philippine negotiators wanted to dwell upon as they sought to portray their year rescheduling agreement as better than Mexico s Finance minister Jaime Ongpin did refer to prepayments at news conference he held New York on Friday to announce rescheduling agreement accompanying press release referred only obliquely to fact pct margin increase to one pct as long as Philippines pays amortizations as agreed banks threat higher margin gives Philippines every incentive to make extra payments government indicated fact do so bankers Furthermore by paying back ahead schedule some loan raised Philippines be hoping to make good impression on international banking community Ongpin country should financing gap before end next year at earliest depending on success Philippine Investment Note issues planned but some bankers say they already braced new loan requests

text.author: By Linda Sieg Reuters
text.body: Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone may been dealt fatal political blow by yen s renewed rapid rise threat trade war United States political analysts Nakasone already under fire over unpopular tax reform plan may now be forced to resign before June economic summit seven industrialised nations if local elections later next month go against candidates his ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP they The close relationship between Nakasone President Reagan important element Nakasone s power base Waseda University Political Science Professor Mitsuru Uchida told Reuters So emergence U S Criticism damages Nakasone Even before latest trade friction flared Nakasone encountering criticism only opposition parties but also within his own LDP over his proposal to levy sales tax Many factions within LDP distancing themselves Nakasone Uchida His position within LDP itself so strongly established today Nakasone who been more popular general public than many LDP members now seeing his public support eroded analysts yen s rise to record highs U S Threat on Friday to impose tariffs on Japanese electronics goods retaliation Japan s alleged violation microchip trade pact now giving Nakasone s critics fresh ammunition analysts Apparently special relationship between Reagan Nakasone hasn t worked effectively Rei Shiratori director Institute Political Studies Japan making Japanese people doubt Nakasone s credibility Shiratori told Reuters cumulative impact sales tax issue yen s rise mounting trade friction could mean serious LDP losses April local elections analysts If elections go against LDP Nakasone may to resign early Shiratori But Nakasone still chance to soothe U S Tempers before or during his week long Washington visit April some analysts However unless Japanese political system can move more quickly to give Nakasone some nice present to take to Washington on smouldering trade issues he face very hostile audience Merrill Lynch Securities economist William Sterling If trip major disaster seem to put final nail his coffin he Reagan s own weakened domestic position growing Republican as well as Democratic anger Japan argue against quick settlement to trade dispute analysts But desire on both sides to find some solution coupled uncertainty at home abroad over likely successors to Nakasone could still lead to attempt to paper over differences aid Nakasone they One factor against trade war may be Washington anxious to push Nakasone into his grave Sterling

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC CHINA RURAL INDUSTRY

text.title: CHINA RURAL INDUSTRY FACES PROBLEMS IN ADVANCING
text.author: By Mark O Neill Reuters
text.body: Workers China s rural factories struggling against variety problems to maintain momentum progress since industrialisation countryside began s When I child we no bicycles We went everywhere on foot land here salty so harvests were good Money food were inadequate When rained water leaked through grass roof Li Wenxian Hongshan Zhejiang Now he other villagers live large two storey concrete homes balconies courtyards But still they face formidable difficulties Many rural factories unable to get raw materials they need or else they find they become too expensive Gao Jianming official Zhejiang s Rural Industry department Zhejiang firms scour China raw materials sometimes they barter finished goods People s Daily month reported pct China s rural factories operate below capacity because power shortages many rural factories lose money because these problems difficulties getting credit poor quality goods competition larger state firms Electricity short busiest periods on farms factories work three to four days week so agriculture can all power needs But more power available at night or on Sundays Gao Rural factories mostly operate outside official plans allocate raw materials under quota at cheap prices to state firms They to compete on open market raw materials whose prices driven up by demand Li Hongshan does suffer power shortages only because cement factory provides cheap cement to electricity supply department raw materials Hongshan s cement to come hundreds miles central China by rail or canal while textile factories buy fabric far northeast industrialisation rural China began late s key part top leader Deng Xiaoping s economic reforms Deng wanted to harness manpower countryside but keep there draw to cities Hongshan set up factories businesses because there enough work on land people Now just workers work full time on land rest work factories making cement plastics textiles transformation rural economy most noticeable along eastern seaboard where communications good labour plentiful land fertile large markets nearby Gao rural factories Zhejiang now employ pct province s labour force such factories first time produced more value than province s farms The industrialising process over When our farms more mechanised many now more labour become available There very big potential Gao Rural industry Zhejiang grown by more than pct year since faster than any other sector economy Goods Hongshan s factories sold all over China Villager Li when Hongshan started building factories illegal but local leaders approved on condition no state money invested We borrowed money to start our cement factory relied on our own resources since then he Another worker Hongshan tea growing collective before rural industrialisation there no point working hard because most people earned same The laziest commune used to laugh at those us who worked more but got same she

text.author: By David Ress Reuters
text.body: Rising imports Japanese made cars electronic goods may upset West European officials but they generally seem prepared to stay on sidelines latest trade row between United States Japan Japan s huge trade surplus sore point West Europe as United States But U S Charges unfair trade practices involving computer microchips leave Europeans cold European Community ran billion dlr trade deficit Japan year seeks redress when feels Japanese trade policy hurts Europeans diplomats economists But only Britain there been any suggestion acting U S To do something Japan s huge trade surplus The EC no more illiberal on trade issues than U S Martin Wolf director studies at Trade Policy Research Centre London Basically their policies pretty much same But did mean Europe support U S Or EC climb on bandwagon to take advantage U S Dispute to press own claims WolfBasically Europeans different approach to trade problems he In U S People talk fair trade but here he added In U S all to do general ethic free competition while Europe general approach liberal trade good because makes countries rich Wolf basic U S Attitude explains Washington s tendency to impose so called countervailing duties import tax designed to offset advantages alleged to be unfair Western Europe approach to trade disputes tends to be to try to reach settlement through negotiation Wolf latest U S Japan trade row President Reagan threatened to raise tariffs on selected Japanese electronic goods by as much as dlrs alleging Japan failed to abide by U S Japan pact on microchip trade But European Community challenged agreement as violation General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT practices discriminates against microchip producers It follows they re likely to rally to side United States defence agreement Wolf Although British parliamentarians pushing tough line on Japanese trade issues government officials rest Europe told correspondents they let EC take lead any response to U S Japan trade row spokeswoman EC Commission Brussels told Reuters there been no change Community s position since March meeting foreign ministers sent strong warning to Tokyo on trade imbalances statement issued after meeting EC foreign ministers deplored Japan s continued trade imbalance appealed greater Japanese effort to open up markets EC External Trade Commissioner Willy De Clercq after talks there growing impatience Japan EC Diplomats accredited to EC Brussels they saw no signs any immediate intention to impose any broad ranging sanctions against Japan EC anxious to avoid provoking trade war they Instead Community trying to target problem areas European trade Japan including wines spirits cosmetics financial services continue talking to try to improve situation diplomats Britain where Bank Japan sources senior central bank official such methods as controlling foreign exchange deals invoking currency swap agreements other central banks been invoked since all being considered But time may be ripe he In era financial liberalisation s almost impossible to control flow capital out Japan another senior bank official But first official From technical viewpoint Bank Japan could activate swap agreements immediately after other central banks involved agreed to do so swap agreement exchange currency between two nations allows both sides to acquire ready source other s currency case need If Bank invokes such swaps both parties announce decision jointly first official sources they believed limit currency market intervention may be being reached after they saw recent concerted market action by central banks major industrial nations increasingly ineffective propping up battered dollar But intervention at least option they Further easing monetary policy be very difficult official discount rate already at record low pct they Bank Japan Governor Satoshi Sumita repeatedly ruled out another rate cut due to fears could revive inflation One bank official he could deny possibilty Bank Japan activating currency swap agreements U S other central banks if these banks continue intervening to sell yen support dollar run out their yen cash positions But we don t think they become short yen quite yet he bank established five billion dlr swap limit U S Federal Reserve another billion mark billion yen limit West German Swiss central banks according to sources Foreign reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC CHINA REFORMS TO TAKE

text.title: CHINA REFORMS TO TAKE DECADES NO ALTERNATIVE
text.author: By Mark O Neill Reuters
text.body: China s economic reforms take decades to fulfill outlast life any leader because they only way to save country poverty economist one country s top think tanks told Reuters But He Weiling Washington representative China Economic System Reform Institute China s economic reforms definitely at risk nationwide drive since January against bourgeois liberalism phrase meaning Western political ideas He bourgeois liberalism affecting departments dealing economics His one small number key institutes set up early s formulate economic reform policies advise top leadership on them Discussing subjects raised budget speech week put deficits at more than billion yuan because excessive consumer demand capital construction plus falling efficiency state firms He reform state firms financial system key goal The most difficult thing to strike balance between making them independent units need central control He We exploring ways doing through joint stock ownership leasing factory management responsibility systems or other ways he added One most serious problems facing China s leaders how to curb excess investment capital construction especially projects outside state plan He problem chronic all socialist economies because firms judged on output profitability or efficiency Firms use every excuse to get money materials They say they want money to build offices but fact use to build apartments unauthorised He Also good to report profits mean higher tax payments better to report loss he added He China s state firms continuing year old tradition when they under report their assets order to reduce claims on them by higher authority He China to improve auditing economic regulations tax system he described as chaotic especially at lower levels order to deal under reporting Another important step to further develop money markets to give firms opportunity to invest They need channels they do now Without there be no genuine supply demand money he As reform to encourage efficiency China now supplies state firms loans instead grants as past But He reforms resulted much real change because loans carry low interest So some efficient firms been able to get money banks Price reform been one most sensitive aspects reform programme Widespread discontent over price rises forced government to promise January there be no major increases He price steel timber cement other industrial raw materials only rise gradually year Large scale price adjustments adverse psychological impact create social discontent We must preserve unity popular support he but sometimes common people must make sacrifice like those Germany Japan after He restrictions on wide range prices including most farm light industrial products been lifted many intermediate pricing schemes scrapped over eight years It take at least to years to complete overhaul price system We must move carefully We no model to work only ourselves to rely on He He greatest fear expressed by foreigners reform open door policies survive death certain elderly leaders He did name top leader Deng Xiaoping chief architect both policies since These fears unfounded two policies already become basic national policy China reforms irreversible China one poorest countries world Without reforms how we to escape poverty

text.title: TAIWAN BANKERS PREDICT MAJOR FINANCIAL REFORM
text.author: By Andrew Browne Reuters
text.body: Taiwan planning to significantly relax foreign exchange controls within next few months but there little prospect sudden outflow capital bankers economists polled by Reuters They statement by Premier Yu Kuo Hua Friday Taiwan might suspend controls indicated government ready to allow Taiwanese firms individuals to hold invest foreign currency first time There been major shift government policy Liang Kuo Shu chairman Chang Hwa Commercial Bank Yu foreign exchange controls under all foreign currency must be converted into Taiwan dollars might be suspended if Taiwan s trade surplus grows too large He controls could be retained use emergency Yu aim to reduce Taiwan s foreign exchange reserves ease pressure on money supply reserves grown to record billion U S Dlrs compared billion late March year due to Taiwan s widening trade surplus surplus hit record billion dlrs year against billion Approximately pct surplus U S surplus first two months year rose to billion dlrs billion same period Money supply grew by seasonally adjusted pct year to end february Bankers economists they did believe government intended to drop all foreign exchange controls allow Taiwan dollar to be freely traded But they over next few months certain restrictions probably be eased to allow Taiwanese firms individuals to hold part their foreign exchange earnings overseas investment Bankers economists also likely government lift ban on investment foreign stocks They uncertain however whether investment be direct or channeled through government approved funds Taiwan allowed firms individuals to invest overseas government bonds treasury bills certificates deposit first time year Bankers Yu s statment indication government becoming increasingly concerned threat inflation posed by growing foreign exchange reserves Inflation now running at three pct Mounting reserves also seen as giving Washington leverage efforts to force Taiwan to boost value currency to reduce trade imbalance Bankers dropping foreign exchange restrictions unlikely to lead to significant capital outflows because rising value Taiwan dollar All signs capital move John Brinsden manager Standard Chartered Bank Taipei Taiwan dollar risen by pct against U S Dollar since September opened today at against American currency Most economists believe Taiwan dollar continue to rise year on strong U S Pressure appreciation Economists estimate up to five billion U S Dlrs speculative money flowed into Taiwan year Yu s statement surprised most local foreign bankers who regard former central bank governor as fiscal arch conservative They shows Taiwan determined to go ahead wide ranging financial liberalisation It s more than straw wind Brinsden It indicates something dramatic happen

text.title: PHILIPPINES CONFIRMS PREPAYMENTS ON NEW DEBT PACT
text.author: By Chaitanya Kalbag Reuters
text.body: Finance Secretary Jaime Ongpin confirmed Philippines agreed to make token prepayments principal to foreign banks as part billion dlr debt restructuring package Reuters report New York yesterday quoted bankers as saying Manila pay dlrs over But Ogpin denied Manila playing down prepayment aspect restructuring They public documents there nothing secret he told Reuters debt accord announced Friday stretched repayments billion dlrs over year period seven half year grace period interest rate margin percentage points over Eurodollar rates Ongpin prepayments were part seven different scenarios Philippine negotiators prepared before talks It one many options we offered banks order to win attractive pricing he prepayments were on dlr nine year loan signed carried four year grace period Principal repayments were due until Ongpin prepayments hardly affect Philippines balance payments position There no problem financing prepayments constitute pct current international reserves billion dlrs he We do plan to cover costs by selling Philippine Investment Notes PINs worth dlrs year PINs negotiable foreign currency denominated instruments be offered to creditor banks designed conversion into pesos to fund government approved equity investments within Philippines Ongpin Manila to repay dlrs year when amortisations on dlr loan came up He bank advisory committee sent telexes accord to country s creditor banks he expected documentation agreement all them by July Foreign bankers here pact gave Manila largest interest rate cut among major debtor nations They Mexico s new debt package October marked point drop debt agreement while Manila s new pact slashed agreement by up to percentage points Venezuela s new margin month only point drop rate agreed rescheduling accord bankers Add to fact Manila frozen principal repayents since while Venezuela amortised six billion dlrs foreign debt since paid back more than eight billion dlrs by end year one added Ongpin Manila s margin meant Philippines pay dlrs year interest when grace period ended

by small but cash rich Pacific Western Airlines Corp launched week as Canadian Airlines International Ltd Canadian Airlines pct billion Canadian dlr domestic market against Air Canada s pct Wardair text.title: TRADE WAR FEARS MAY PROMPT STOCK MARKETS DOWNTURN
text.author: By David Ress Reuters
text.body: The threatened trade war between United States Japan just kind shock economists say could send world stock markets into tailspin But they so sure if be brief corrective dip or whether week s falling share prices mark start bear market It s billion dollar question Richard O Brien economist at American Express International Bank London Japan s trade surplus billion dlrs year poured into share bond markets around world funded good chunk huge U S Budget deficit Around third any new sale U S Treasury bonds been bought by Japanese However Japanese investors lost money as dollar falls lose more if United States lets fall further to cut trade deficit counterpart improving trade deficit either through lower dollar or because U S Increases duties on Japanese electronic goods may be to hit capital inflow financed budget deficit if U S Trade deficit does fall Japanese less money to invest To entice U S Investors to fill gap be left if Japanese stopped buying U S Bonds interest rates to soar O Brien subsequent shift shares to bonds could cause major falls on world stock markets A year ago we could be pretty confident markets O Brien Now much less certain Buoyant share prices supposed to reflect booming economy But world economy sluggish growth at best industrial nations massive load Third World debt huge trade imbalances good shape O Brien Nevertheless New York analyst William Raferty Smith Barney Harris Upham We re still bull market adding corrections normal part rising market The bear usually strikes slowly Economist Evelyn Brody at Morgan Grenfell Co London huge sums money going through world financial system keep floor under share bond prices Although interest by Japanese putting their money non dollar denominated bonds stocks increased s very difficult to see where else they can put their money than U S Dollars especially U S Treasury bond market according to David Butcher senior executive at Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd s bond operation London He Japanese paying much closer attention now to French franc West German mark longer run he worries what trade tensions dollar s slide mean securities markets

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC TALKING POINT BORG WA

text.title: TALKING POINT BORG WARNER CORP BOR
text.author: By Patti Domm Reuters
text.body: Borg Warner Corp vigorously resist GAF Corp s dlr per share takeover offer but Midwest conglomerate may fall prey to another offer either GAF or own management analysts believe Analysts also Borg Warner may attempt to escape GAF through restructuring speculation pushed Borg Warner s stock up to heavy trading Analysts predicted feisty GAF Chairman Samuel Heyman stage tough campaign to gain control Borg Warner so he can add profitable plastics chemical business to GAF It seems at least their dealing raider Irwin Jacobs they don t want to be taken over question now do they acquiesce to GAF I think instinctively they want to remain independent Dudley Heer Duff Phelps Borg Warner been under siege by takeover speculation almost year week Jacobs investment vehicle Minstar Inc investor group sold Borg Warner shares same day GAF Corp raised stake by shares to pct outstanding Jacobs interested buying company but took no steps toward transaction Their Borg Warner policy been to stonewall them nine months s been one dullest corporate battles I ve seen one analyst battle however heated up range breakup values on Wall Street span current market price to almost dlrs per share Most analysts they think price low s be appropriate Arbitragers speculate GAF give up easily on billion dlr offer to buy balance Borg Warner Analysts who know GAF predict Heyman either end up Borg Warner or enrich his chemicals building materials company some other way Heyman two years ago attempted unsuccessful takeover Union Carbide Corp but GAF benefited company s restructuring Borg Warner can t quibble s legitimate offer seems to me short Borg Warner kind between rock hard place They either to accept dlr proposal or perhaps work deal where s sweetened I personally think company worth around dlrs per share Pershing analyst Richard Henderson Henderson also speculated company might attempt restructuring such as one carried out by Goodyear Tire Rubber Co year when being courted by Sir James Goldsmith company bought back financier s stock carried out wider share repurchase Arbitragers however they do believe Heyman seeking greenmail or repurchase his stock by company at premium Analysts noted Heyman seems to no problems financing transaction Previously associated junk bond experts Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc GAf finance Borg Warner takeover bank financing GAF make tender offer following merger agreement approved by Borg WArner board conditioned on board s recommendation tender offer merger Heyman letter to Borg Warner he expects merger provide job security Borg Warner employees since two companies businesses overlap Analysts however believe Heyman sell off assets he did want to repay debt transaction GAF s stock rose today to I believe obviously if GAF takes over Borg Warner at level proposing enhance GAF share values substantially Oppenheimer analyst Charles Rose He at dlrs per share Heyman s average cost company s stock be dlrs per share based on GAF s current holdings Rose Borg Warner plastics chemical business makes thermo plastics asset attracting Heyman Analysts accounts third Borg s earnings plastics used telephone equipment office equipment appliances Borg half market U S leading technical player leading innovator Rose competitors Dow Chemical Co DOW Monsanto Corp MTC he Borg Warner also automotive parts business protective systems business includes Wells Fargo security guards also information services business trying to sell financial services business Borg Warner earned dlrs or dlrs per share on revenues billion dlrs Smaller GAF earned on operating basis dlrs or dlrs per share on sales dlrs GAF s net earnings included after tax gain participation Union Carbide exchange offer special union carbide dividend sale Union Carbide shares

text.body: Imperial Oil Ltd pct owned by Exxon Corp XON negotiating major crude oil suppliers concerning effects trial deregulation Alberta s shut in crude oil production scheduled to be implemented on June company spokesman From our point view s question entering into negotiations or discussions to make appropriate changes to contracts to reflect changes going to take place on June spokesman John Cote told Reuters reply to query Commenting on published reports Imperial suspended oil supply contracts Cote It s question cancelling or suspending any agreements at point On June Alberta s Energy Resources Conservation Board lift crude oil marketing prorationing system regulating shut in light medium crude production on trial basis to end Under new system producers refiners be allowed to negotiate volumes shut in oil to be delivered under purchase contracts Shut in crude surplus between total amount oil being produced amount being purchased by refiners We talked to number our major suppliers we ve discussed upcoming change them but nothing been finalized Imperial s manager western crude supply Gary Strong Under Alberta s trial system Imperial wants to match reasonable supply crude against company s forecast demand refineries Strong We to know what they how relates to what we need total he Strong figures on amount crude production Imperial purchases outside suppliers were immediately available

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC GM GM LABOR STRIFE

text.title: GM GM LABOR STRIFE PRECURSOR TO TOUGH TALKS
text.author: By Scott Williams Reuter
text.body: General Motors Corp s relationship hourly employees turned ugly security analysts say discord forebodes tough talks fall on new national labor contract at General Motors General Motors dealings United Auto Workers marred recent months by strikes contract rejections shows few signs improving as tries to regain lead Ford Motor Co F as richest U S auto company Analysts say automaker might to endure major strike fall before situation resolved There lot tension between workers GM says Michael Luckey analyst Shearson Lehman Brothers week s four day walkout by UAW workers at Pontiac Mich follows longer strikes at two General Motors parts plants past year rejection proposed contracts at other facilities Analysts say Pontiac strike be to hit company Other plant strikes likely chances high UAW call company wide walkout against GM fall says Luckey There good chance there be strike says Salomon Brothers analyst Jean Claude Gruet GM acting as if they welcome strike Ron Glantz analyst Montgomery Securities It been my experience UAW strikes people they don t like They don t like GM says Glantz General Motors might also be faced wildcat strikes or walkouts by local union units endorsed by union s central committee analysts General Motors comment on talks saying only seeking to become world class competitor Elements tough set labor talks place There lot pressure on both sides General Motors chairman Roger Smith under pressure stockholders union fighting to protect members Something got to give Luckey says consensus on Wall Street General Motors be chosen as strike target or main company negotiate fall talks to decide next three year national contract You get feeling talking GM they want to be strike target because they feel Ford might capitulate too easily says Glantz negotiations expected to begin late July decide major wage benefit job security issues cover most U S autoworkers current contract expires September Job security outsourcing subcontracting jobs to non UAW labor expected to be main issues You re going to see rough set negotiations particularly if they can t get outsourcing issue decided says one former General Motors human relations executive Some analysts point out if UAW decides to focus on wages might pick Ford as strike target because Ford s higher earnings year You may see situation where UAW bargains two separately breaking historical pattern says Luckey number cars building up dealer showrooms might indicate General Motors preparing confrontation union analysts say company days supply cars dealer showrooms at end March Lucky estimates Analysts say to days supply normal General Motors wants to enter negotiations with enough inventory won t feel six week strike says Glantz Some industry say despite closing plants indefinite layoff workers further closings layoffs might be coming General Motors spokesman says too early to know whether plant closures become issue talks former General Motors executive says more closures likely after new UAW agreement reached but he adds you re going to see before contract he says Lucky says pct General Motors s components plants on red list companies likely to be shut It take miracle them to survive he says

reuters.unknown: V RM f reute u f BC ANALYSTS SEE SLOW MOV

text.title: ANALYSTS SEE SLOW MOVE TO HIGHER U S PRIME RATE
text.author: By Martin Cherrin Reuters
text.body: Quarter point prime rate increases to pct by Citibank Chase Manhattan Bank today be followed by other banks only after they see clearer signs Federal Reserve s policy intentions economists Based on spread between banks cost funds prime rate probably makes sense others to follow but no rush likely Paul McCulley E F Hutton Co Citibank s surprise base rate increase quickly followed by Chase sent U S bond prices lower dollar higher McCulley once spread between three month certificates deposit prime rate narrows to less than percentage points there strong chance prime rate increase been under points recently However banks likely to hold rate increases until they see what Fed intends to do interest rates near term analysts They noted banks historically like to follow Fed rate movements rather than lead them example prime rate increase occurred June when banks lifted rate to pct pct after Fed discount rate increase April year Major banks been posting pct prime rate since August when they lowered rate eight pct shortly after Fed s half point discount rate cut to current pct level on August The banks rush to raise their prime rates There should be split prime while some posting pct rate others pct David Jones Aubrey G Lanston Co Jones Federal Open Market Committee at today s meeting voted no change Fed policy But he Fed may well foster higher interest rates soon Jones while FOMC probably voted no policy change today may decided to apply slight upward rate pressure later if dollar weakens inflation pressures heat up or economy shows sign strong recovery The Fed clearly indicated they did intend to tighten policy when they did today s coupon pass Joseph Liro S G Warburg Co move came day earlier than most expected Fed today supplied permanent reserves to banking system by offering to buy all maturities Treasury notes bonds own account seasonal reserve add called pass The Fed demonstrated there been no policy change Elizabeth Reiners economist at Dean Witter Reynolds Inc She spread between banks cost funds prime rate now around basis points compared basis point average Reiners spread really narrow enough to present clear need prime rate increase Dean Witter economist today s prime rate rise may been less response to interest rates than attempt to enhance balance sheet bottom line Reiners given recent problems loans to developing countries large money center banks heavy exposures might be first to match higher prime rate effort to get more profitable spreads on other loans Federal funds rate at banks lend overnight money to one another could help determine how many banks match higher prime rate also how quickly they move raising their prime rates banks cited higher cost funds three business days through Monday Federal funds rate at reuters.unknown: A RM f reute r f BC U S FED EXPLORES COM

text.title: U S FED EXPLORES COMMODITY BASKET INDEX
text.author: By Alver Carlson Reuters
text.body: The complex task wielding control over monetary policy increasingly fast moving global economy could be aided by tying policy to commodity prices newest member Federal Reserve Board says Commodity prices already considered by Fed making monetary policy But they be given much greater role under idea being floated by Governor Robert Heller who joined board August He conceeds much more study idea needed but argues such arrangement particularly if were adopted by other major industrial countries could reduce volatility exchange rates Moreover could help stabilize prices commodities themselves slowing changes inflation His idea many conservative economists find appealing some backing among board members appointed recent years by President Reagan complement present system opening or closing monetary screws based on pattern inflation key indicators such as unemployment rise or fall money supply Changes money supply can lead to changes interest rates affect economic activity directly Discussed on off long time commodity concept part growing search system anchors monetary policy widely fluxtuating currency prices to more solid base What needed anchor or reference point can serve as guide both domestic international monetary purposes says Heller past anchor gold but United States went off gold standard because global economy vastly outstripped gold supplies return to gold standard generally dismissed out hand by most policymakers on grounds largest producers gold Soviet Union South Africa so called fixed rate system scuttled early s still considered unworkable present world But current system floating currencies currencies can fluxtuate widely adding vast pressures to monetary system also being widely questioned Some suggested system might benefit formal approach mandates intervention by countries when currencies wander above or below agreed to levels but there major problems also one thing there justifiable concern countries might be relunctant to intervene if they felt might be detrimental to their own domestic economy Moreover some question whether concerted intervention can make much inpact if overall market does agree fundamental judgement poorest countries called monetary conference to work out new system surprisingly helps them cope their overpowering debt problems Treasury Secretary James Baker Reagan administration s chief economic architect preferred to use so called Group Five industrial countries or sometimes Seven as forum to work out cooperative agreements on currency other economic matters He appears convinced officials West Germany France Britain Japan Italy Canada talking quietly behind closed doors can reached reasoned decisions away public posturing Heller approach while extremely complex could profound impact on system ideally stabalizing prices international exchange rates As envisioned by Heller basket say major commodities ranging wheat to oil be put together prices be measured on regular basis In times rising commodity prices monetary policy might be tightened times falling commodity prices montary policy might be eased he says He notes commodity prices traded daily auction markets commodity price index can be calculated on virtually continuous basis Moreover most commodity prices produced consumed traded on world wide basis so that index relevance entire world he says addition commodity prices at beginning production chain serve as imput into virtually all production processes Focusing on commodity prices as early sensitive indicator current perhaps also future prices pressures monetary authorities may take such index into account making their monetary policy decisions he says However he says any major change basic commodity such as occurred oil during s because action by OPEC cartel to be discounted such system He says worst thing could happen to allow monetary policy to spread freakish increase one commodity to rest system to other commodities

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT CHINA MUST PRESERVE FARMLAND
text.author: By Mark O Neill Reuters
text.body: If we go on using up farmland as we done since there be none left years to grow grain on Xu Jinfeng middle aged official Fengbang village on edge Shanghai sums up dilemma China faces as tries to feed more than one billion people at same time let them get richer by building factories new homes China to feed one quarter world s population but only one seventh land arable Sharp increases farm output since turned China into net grain exporter first time again But rapid industrialisation countryside occurred at same time gobbled up arable land factories homes peasants who can now afford them Official figures show China lost just under one pct arable land to other uses slightly smaller amount year gained new mouths to feed during two years We lost very little land prior to when industrialisation began official Xu Since then nearly all families county built new homes many factories gone up Last year we lost land to new railway line Xu But land losses future should fall because nearly all families already new houses she added issue land loss matter major concern to Peking leadership announced earlier month China issue nationwide quotas conversion grain land first time year The present situation abusing occupying unlawfully wasting destroying land land resources serious article official press explaining new measures It resulted great losses cultivated farmland China large population land resources badly deficient official Shanghai city government county authorities could approve conversion only hectares arable land to other uses while anything more than must be approved by city government Peking government faces another major obstacle efforts to ensure China s people get enough grain to eat prices state pays to farmers grain too low making more profitable them to grow other crops To offset state offers farmers cheap fertiliser diesel oil payment advance grain contracts to buy state then sells grain at subsidised prices to China s city residents Rural factories also subsidise grain output paying farmers bonuses to grow Some officials argue simplest solution to problem be state to raise city grain prices Chen Zuyuan Communist Party secretary village eastern province Zhejiang government listened too much to demands selfish city people could raise city grain prices without any problem But government ruled out price rise Raising price grain directly conflict goal social stability China Daily editorial month Shanghai official prices must be reformed over long term We must be very careful We very large population used to price stability object to price rises he The problem how to do Shanghai official rise grain prices might also affect prices hundreds food products made grain consumed by city residents addition state faces problem inadequate investment by farmers land grain particular official press reported farmers fear farm policy may change they putting their new wealth into building graves memorial halls ancestors homes Under reforms introduced late s farmers sign contracts state requiring them to grow certain crops but they considerable freedom how to use their land As expiration date year contract almost at halfway mark farmers beginning to worry future China Daily editorial month Their anxieties stem fact they allowed to use land but own most period Communist rule land organised into collectives where there little room individual initiative New measures needed to reassure them consistency government policies make them interested long term investment newspaper

text.author: By Joshua So Reuters
text.body: Investors unloading holdings Hong Kong stocks following spate new share issues by leading local firms analysts Hang Seng index fell to yesterday on speculation Hutchison Whampoa Ltd planned bonus issue new B shares After yesterday s market close Hutchison parent Cheung Kong Holdings Ltd both announced one for two bonus issues B shares news sent index down points to today s morning session Cheung Kong companies issues followed Jardine Matheson Holdings Ltd s announcement on Friday four for one bonus issue new B shares There also market speculation Evergo Industrial Enterprise Ltd make similar move following request suspension share trading by firm today Analysts these new issues adverse impact on trading James Miller Day director County Securities Asia Ltd I don t like concept B shares because create inequality among equities He issue B shares could create conflict interest holders other classes shares noting most B shares issued at par value equivalent to one tenth text.title: AUSTRALIA STOCK EXCHANGES ENTER NEW ERA
text.author: By Peter Bale Reuters
text.body: The Australian Stock Exchange Ltd ASX today took up responsibility administering new coordinated market made up Australia s six former exchanges now operating as subsidiary trading floors At same time rules prohibiting corporations non stock exchange members holding more than pct Australia s brokerage firms were abolished leaving brokers exposed to greater deregulation Industry sources moves smooth changeover to screen based trading give equities market one voice Westpac Banking Corp WSTP S one first to take advantage changes by announcing today double stake Sydney firm Ord Minnett Ltd to pct Brokers been introduced to creeping deregulation over past three years after legislation passed to end restrictive trade practices forced traditional partnerships to open themselves at first to partial ownership by outside institutions eventually to full ownership phase in period ended several major banks offshore financial institutions investigating taking larger stakes Australian broking houses industry sources Though deregulation all but forced on brokers most now acknowledge influx capital contacts non member shareholders benefited industry they Deregulation brought infusion additional capital broader base products ASX chairman Ian Roach told Reuters Roach fears major bank shareholders impose restrictive conservative bank culture on dynamic sharebroking industry were unfounded So far banks been mindful importance preserving entrepreneurial aspect sharebroking he But some brokers others sceptical expect expiration golden handcuff pacts tied partners to their firms period after incorporation could cause massive talent drain Several leading brokers already announced plans to leave their firms establish new private client businesses while others plan public floats While bank shareholders enjoyed dabbling broking during Australia s record two and a half year bull run they could find themselves without expertise they need during more difficult times some brokers Rene Rivkin head Sydney brokerage house Rivkin James Capel Ltd many brokers resist anything restricts their individuality entrepreneurial spirit could leave new entrants into business short staffed If I were bank I m sure I gone into broking What s going to happen when lot these golden handcuffs come to end Rivkin Only then banks know what they ve got he Rivkin s firm pct owned by Hongkong Shanghai Banking Corp HKBH HK unit Wardley Australia Ltd plans public float between pct My relationship Hong Kong bank wonderful They leave me alone give me all support I need Maybe if we weren t doing so well there wouldn t be support but hasn t happened he Other firms might be so lucky he they could find difficult to preserve their independence when bull market ends two years value Australian sharemarket leapt pct turnover value up pct to billion dlrs year to June growth put existing trading systems clearing houses under pressure unification six sovereign exchanges should accelerate development screen based trading single clearing house industry sources July year leading stocks be traded pilot ASX s screen trading system depending on reception by brokers expected to replace trading floors over next four years industry sources

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC TURKISH BANKS ANNOUNC

text.title: TURKISH BANKS ANNOUNCE HIGHER PROFITS FOR
text.author: By Ragip Erten Reuters
text.body: Turkey s banks reporting strong recovery profits but government drive to liberalise capital markets poses new challenges to banking industry seeking to broaden earnings base dozen Turkey s banks announced higher profits so far trend bankers financial capital Istanbul expect to be reflected through most industry But while Ankara s policy liberalising markets offers new opportunites to expand operations some bankers see dangers attached to related drive to push down Turkish interest rates Bankers government s policy fostering lower interest rates could lead to consumer boom reignite inflation currently running at pct They worry could further reduce industry s shrinking deposit base given added urgency to bank moves to build up their capital market operations as Turkey s market oriented Prime Minister Turgut Ozal liberalises financial system Bankers recovery earnings stemmed partly foreign exchange operations trade finance But growing volume trading government securities now also major source revenue banks Bankers proportion bank profits generated traditional financing commerce industry falling some even been making loss on these operations major challenge to bank profits Turkey came when government faced worst financial crisis years raised domestic interest rates sharply to fight inflation rate over pct launched export drive Deniz Gokce associate professor economics at Bosphorus University told Reuters banks were forced to pay depositors real interest rates first time profits started to fall Previously rates been below inflation Turkey s domestic banks also partly missed out on export drive as foreign banks moved into Istanbul reaped benefits trade finance their added expertise number foreign banks risen to just two Although local banks tried to follow suit Turkey s exports declined year to billion dlrs billion bankers doubt there enough business to go round As result banks including few foreign operations started moving into capital market operations to broaden their earnings base take advantage relaunch just over year ago Istanbul Stock Exchange When we saw there demand supply money outside banking system we could envisage ourselves excluded these transactions Osman Erk deputy general manager private bank Yapi ve Kredi Bankasi AS number banks active at exchange mainly trading government securities went up to year when market revived December Liberalisation went one step further week when parliament passed law encouraging companies to go public month Yapi ve Kredi Bankasi launched country s first commercial paper programme joint venture chemical firm Medium sized private Pamukbank AS announced strong recovery pre tax profit to billion lira while Yapi ve Kredi Bankasi profits increased to billion lira billion Bankers both benefited trade finance increased capital market operations Turkey s second biggest bank private Turkiye Bankasi announced profit rise to billion billion However bankers some banks been window dressing their balance sheets to mask non performing loans variously estimated by bankers at between to pct industry s billion lira total credits Non performing loans began to mount early s as industry failed to cope higher interest rates started to default Some banks continued to count loans as performing After all banks started to be more careful giving credits so non performing loans problem period between to Erk But problem bad loans led to rescue by three state banks medium sized Turkiye Ogretmenler Bankasi AS earlier year when Treasury acts as watchdog body over banks discovered assets were to large extent made up non performing loans Some billion lira out bank s billion lira loan portfolio non performing But bank reported pre tax profit lira Bankers cited as typical example how balance sheets could hide problems despite drive by central bank to standardise accounting Gokce only solution be compulsory auditing by international accounting companies

reuters.unknown: RM C M f reute u f BC PROPOSED JAPAN TAX MA

text.title: PROPOSED JAPAN TAX MAY DAMPEN TOKYO GOLD TRADING
text.body: A proposed sales tax on gold transactions could put damper on Tokyo market encourage shift trading to Hong Kong Singapore senior vice president Tokyo branch manager Credit Suisse Paul Hofer told press conference If you impose five pct on both buy sell transactions Tokyo participants gold market could be out business he tax create such spread Japanese be unable to compete international market he added How can government really raise taxes if system they impose prohibitive generating business he government now imposes pct tax on physical trades exceeding yen gold jewellery coins yen tax per yen on futures transactions gold dealers new five pct tax be imposed on companies trading more than yen year apply to paper gold trades gold deposits banks trading gold bars as well as jewellery coins dealers However tax lower rate on jewellery coins to only five pct current pct they Hofer Switzerland imposed pct gold turnover tax on Jan but abolished on Oct study by one Swiss banks showed early first year tax volume all Swiss banks fell by up to pct compared Hofer Transactions paper gold also fell up to pct volume prior to imposition tax he While gold transactions Switzerland decreased volume trades outside country particularly London Luxembourg increased between pct Hofer Japan major importer gold buying yearly average just under tonnes gold dealers year Japan imported tonnes gold but government bought tonnes minting coins to commemorate th year Emperor Hirohito s reign dealers Gold trading Tokyo dominated mainly by Japanese trading companies while Credit Suisse major foreign participant Daily turnover Tokyo spot market ranges between one tonnes average around three tonnes while futures turnover amounts to four tonnes gold dealers All us concerned daily fact Tokyo market growing Japan becoming one three major financial markets world my personal opinion I think be very big mistake to put damper on positive growth or developments by imposing such tax Hofer I don t think fits philosophy internationalising market he added Officials several major Japanese trading houses attending press conference they supported Credit Suisse s call government to impose gold tax

text.title: INDIAN RATE CUTS TO SPARK INDUSTRY AGRICULTURE
text.body: The Indian Finance Ministry s announcement Parliament yesterday changing nation s interest rate structure benefit industry agriculture by providing loans at lower interest bankers brokers changes effective today included reducing commercial bank lending rates ranged between pct pct by one percentage point New rates affect both Indian foreign banks also include one percentage point gain to annual pct on deposits two years or more but less than five Bank deposits five years or more carrying pct interest been abolished Bankers interest rate modifications reflect government s concern to reduce costs borrowing help improve world competitiveness Indian goods There likely to be shift to short term bank deposits by long term depositors bankers predicted create flexibility to draw re invest funds either equity shares or short term bank deposits they merchant banker also reduced manufacturing costs due to lower lending rates likely to boost share market Tata Steel trend setter on Bombay Stock Exchange opened today higher at rupees against yesterday s closing rupees stockbroker investors may be less enthusiastic now to buy convertible non convertible debentures because Finance Ministry reduced annual interest rate to pct pct respectively pct respectively But overall debenture prospects remain bright because rates interest on them still be higher than what banks pay deposits similar maturity merchant banker

text.title: MALAYSIA DECLINES TO STATE POSITION ON COCOA PACT
text.author: By Rajan Moses Reuters
text.body: Government officials Malaysia major cocoa producer declined to say whether join International Cocoa Agreement ICCA buffer stock rules were agreed London week Ministry Primary Industries officials January cabinet decide on Malaysia s participation but so far decision been announced government to be favour joining pact but local cocoa growers traders told Reuters they against idea because certain provisions may be to their disadvantage Malaysia world s fourth largest cocoa producer government feels pact through buffer stock mechanism can help stabilise prices market labouring under surpluses officials But growers traders concerned Malaysia s participation pact require them to pay levy exports cocoa to non member countries ICCA They estimate levy at around ringgit tonne at current prices they prepared to accept because big portion Malaysia s cocoa exports officially estimated at tonnes goes to non members Most growers traders added they also against buffer stock measure under agreement requires withholding cocoa stocks when prices slump Malaysia produced tonnes cocoa year might be forced to withhold up to tonnes worth some ringgit under such measure long term might affect their economic viability they The cost maintaining such stock can be high be real messy business government trade if ever occurs industry source growers traders also under new buffer stock rules Malaysia can continue to benefit even if member pact as buffer stock manager also allowed to buy non members stockpile Under new rules purchases non members such as Malaysia be limited to pct total stock Malaysia come under pressure some producers to join pact soon officials but they noted need rush to do so as there provisions allow countries to join agreement even at later date

text.title: U S SUPREME COURT ALLOWS DELTA WESTERN MERGER
text.body: U S Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day O Connor early morning lifted Appeals Court injunction blocking planned merger Delta DAL Airlines Inc Western Airlines WAL Court O Connor s action came hours after three judge panel th U S Circuit Court Appeals San Francisco blocked merger until dispute over union representation been settled by arbitration Supreme Court spokesman O Connor granted stay injuction allowing merger worth nearly dlrs to go through as planned later today Supreme Court spokesman provided no other details Each nine Supreme Court justices jurisdiction over particular regional Appellate circuit power to provisionally overturn rulings without comment Appeals Court ruling surprised officials Atlanta based Delta been preparing merger months already painted Delta logos on airplanes belonging to Western headquartera Los Angeles Our plans were to finalize merger at midnight tonight Delta spokesman Bill Berry told Atlanta Constitution late night There really very little remained to be done ruling San Francisco came lawsuit been filed Los Angeles federal court Air Transport Employees union sought to force Western s management to fulfill promise honor union contracts if merger took place airlines argued Western s promise could be enforced takeover by larger company After learning appeals court ruling Delta officials night spread word by telephone Western employees should report work today their old uniforms new Delta outfits Delta announced September purchasing Western merger took place December Western been operated as Delta subsidiary since then Western name to disappeared at midnight night At issue whether Western unions continue to represent Western employees after integration two airlines While all but eight pct Western s employees unionized only Delta s pilots union members Delta maintained three unions having contracts Western Association Flight Attendants Teamsters as well as Air Transport Employees be extinguished after today

text.body: Tanzania need billion dlrs hard currency investment to support five year plan begins July Minister State Finance Damas Mbogoro He told economic planning seminar northern town Arusha yesterday new plan concentrate on rehabilitating Tanzania s existing infrastructure minimum investment new development projects aim to boost agricultural production by five pct year industrial output by pct he before president Ali Hassan Mwinyi began dismantling Tanzania s doctrinaire socialist policies to implement his current economic recovery program agricultural production grew by only pct while industrial output declined by pct Mbogoro success new five year plan depend greatly on ability to exercise self discipline make best use limited resources Prime Minister Joseph Warioba Finance Minister Cleopa Msuya both stressed government departments must exercise financial discipline live within their budgets

text.title: KENYAN MINISTER FORECASTS ECONOMIC EXPANSION
text.body: Kenya s economy continue to expand year government do more to encourage investment by foreign firms local private sector Planning Minister Robert Ouko He told news conference government soon create special bureau to expedite processing investment applications by local foreign investors Praising role multinational companies local entrepreneurs Kenya s economy minister promised to maintain close working contact private sector economy grew by pct year up pct Ouko owing to high prices country s coffee exports low oil prices low inflation rising real incomes he added Despite rising petroleum prices falling coffee prices Kenya s economy still expected to improve planning minister High aggregate demand arising low inflation trade liberalisation disciplined financial
